abstract.p: Letter from Elena Deutsch (American Cancer Society) on May 4 and 7 articles holds second-hand smoke is proven killer

block.p: Re ''Where There's Smoke There's a New Rule Against It'' (Public Lives, May 7) and ''The Puritans Run Amok Over Smoking'' (NYC column, May 4):
Re ''Where There's Smoke There's a New Rule Against It'' (Public Lives, May 7) and ''The Puritans Run Amok Over Smoking'' (NYC column, May 4):
The public discussion about whether smoking should be allowed indoors should emphasize a key fact: secondhand smoke is a proven killer.

In 1993, the Environmental Protection Agency classified secondhand smoke as a Group A carcinogen, the same category as asbestos, benzene, arsenic and radon. Would co-op residents prefer arsenic in their drinking water?

There is no safe exposure level for Group A carcinogens. It's more than a question of comfort. Secondhand smoke kills 50,000 people every year from heart and lung disease -- more than all other Group A carcinogens combined.
The writer is director of tobacco control, American Cancer Society, Eastern Division.
